titleStmt.title: J. H. Richard et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5525

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Gov Thos. E. Bramblett

The Undersigned Citizens of Bath County would respectfully represent that C. W. Honaker was at the December Term 1863 of the Bath Circuit Court fined for silling spiritious liquors to a minor one Geo. Trumbo. That said Trumbo although under age would be taken for over 21. That the offence was committed about the time the act against such offenses took effect and ^at^ that time said Honaker did not know such an act had been passed. We are confident he did not intend to violate the law and that the fine ought to be remitted-

T. Donagan
V. B. Young
R. L. Tipton
Geo Abraham
Col. Eli W. Fleming
Wm W. Cartmill
C P Browning
John J Swetnam Lt. B. R.
James, F, Denton Lieut B. R.
J. H. Richard
S A J Lea
B.. Hunt
R Coulthard
J. J. Lightfoot
E. V. Brother
Wm Richard
Thos. P. Daugherty
John Miller
Samuel McQuithy
J. C. Bussey Capt Bath Ranger
S C Bascom
John T. Kimbrough
G L Coyle
W Taylor
J. S. Dury

Bath County
Remit except costs & fees
Tho E Bramlette
